intro: Stisseria juvencula, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its fruits are berries that contain several seeds. Stisseria juvencula is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its unique nocturnal blooming habit.
